required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nesiritide for Ventilated Congestive Heart Failure
clinical_study.official_title: Hemodynamic Effects of Nesiritide on Congestive Heart Failure Patients Receiving Mechanical Ventilation: A Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: The congestive heart failure is a common disease among patients who receive cardiac surgery and may lead to prolonged ventilation support. Nesiritide was a potential therapy for congestive heart failure. This study aimed to compare the Nesiritide induced hemodynamical status changes among congestive heart failure patients with invasive ventilation support.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 30-min after using a standard dose of Nesiritide
primary_outcome.description: Changes of cardiac output measured by hemodynamical monitoring tools

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 30-min after using a standard dose of Nesiritide
primary_outcome.description: Changes of the intercept of regression line of paired VR-RAP points at different PEEP levels.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 30-min after using a standard dose of Nesiritide
secondary_outcome.description: Using body position changes (±15°) to simulate the change of preload, and therefore depicte the Starling curve

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before and 30-min after using a standard dose of Nesiritide
secondary_outcome.description: Changes of venous return curve depicted by different PEEP setting

intervention.description: The attending physicans decide whether to use Nesiritide for congestive heart failure patients. Only patients who will use Nesiritide are enrolled.

study_pop.textblock: Congestive heart failure patients relying on mechanical ventilation and therefore decide to try the Nesiritide.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age≥18 years；
- Congestive Heart Failure;
- With mechanical ventilation；
- With hemodynamic monitoring devices;
- The physicians made the decision of using Nesiritide.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable hemodynamic status；
- Severe renal dysfunction.

patient_data.ipd_description: Our institution did not approve this.
